definition: shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

sentences.english: The 11-13th century was one transitional period of Byzantine society.
sentences.chinese: 13世紀是拜佔廷社會的一個轉折時期。

sentences.english: The 2011 year of white metal rabbit (hare, cat) is a year of great transformations.
Evazan was expecting such a turn of events, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這一轉折正是埃瓦贊所期望的。

sentences.english: Late adolescence is another transition, this time to leaving home altogether.
sentences.chinese: 青年期後期是另一個轉折，這時候完全地離開家。

sentences.english: The turning point of the Ming Dynasty from prosperity to decline was the reign of Emperor Shenzong.
sentences.chinese: 明朝由盛到衰的轉折點是明神宗的統治。

sentences.english: Stocks are slightly lower as investors weigh up the chances of whether this is a major turning point.
sentences.chinese: 投資者考量這是一個重要轉折點的機率，股市小跌。

sentences.english: Which makes them at the beginning of the Tiger issued a sonorous voice of the turn.
sentences.chinese: 這使得他們在虎年伊始發出了鏗鏘有力的轉折之聲。

sentences.english: My wall-painting mission continues, and last weekend there was a long story full of twists and turns.
sentences.chinese: 上個週末的壁畫工程又是一段充滿轉折的故事。

sentences.english: The turning point in Saudi policy came in the spring of 2002.
sentences.chinese: 沙特阿拉伯政策的轉折點是2002年春天。

sentences.english: As a Capricorn you've been going through vast life changes.
sentences.chinese: 作爲魔羯，你正在經歷很大的人生轉折。

sentences.english: Valley Forge was a turning point in the American Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 弗吉谷是美國革命史上的轉折點。

sentences.english: The results show saddle-node bifurcation arises in the turning point of amplitude-frequency curve.
sentences.chinese: 研究結果表明幅頻曲線轉折點出現鞍結分叉。

sentences.english: Its emergence and development is an important turning point in the history of lacquer ware.
sentences.chinese: 它的出現與發展是漆藝史上的重要轉折。

sentences.english: Revolution of the Xinhai Year was the turning point to the national industry in Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命對浙江的民族工業來說是一個重要的轉折點。

sentences.english: “This was a very important turning point for China’s economy, ” he says.
sentences.chinese: 吳說，“這份報告是中國經濟的一個重要轉折點”。

sentences.english: Was that something of a watershed for Spanish football?
sentences.chinese: 可以認爲那是西班牙足球的轉折點嗎？

definition: line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
